column4: Okay... Obviously I should be more careful with what I do in an apt-get, as I can now see that I approved it to remove Gnome... But would somebody please look at it and tell me why it did it to begin with so I can prevent it from happening again... Contrary to what the computer thought, I actually do use gnome.... Pastebin: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/20576/
I am guessing that you removed ubuntu-desktop correct?
Because ubuntu-desktop brings in gnome, apt was just telling you that since you removed ubuntu-desktop you might also want to remove it's dependencies, one of which is gnome
